result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:52 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Brandon D Willis in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Brandon D Willis.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kershek provides an update; he has most of the discovery but is still waiting on some digital discovery.  Atty. Kershek requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

8:38 AM Defendant Brandon D Willis in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Brandon D Willis.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with any passengers in the vehicle listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of the case.

3:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Brandon D Willis in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Brandon D Willis. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
